Day-to-Day 


Insight Global is looking for an Data Architect for one of our Largest Retail Clients. This successful candidate will be responsible for the end-to-end design and architecture of data solutions that support our Analytics, BI and ML/AI capabilities. He or she will be responsible for conceptualizing, designing and implementing future-proof data architectures at project and enterprise levels.

 


Desired Skills and Experience 


• Experience with Cloud platforms like Azure, GCP or AWS.

• Expert in data warehousing, big data and cloud technologies with focus on the data architecture discipline.

• Experience in architecture, design and development of enterprise data solutions that enables well integrated transactional, BI and analytical platforms.

• Strong experience with relational databases (Teradata, Oracle, SQL Server), big data technologies (Hadoop, Hive)

• Hands-on experience with data modeling, analysis, metadata and quality.

• Advanced knowledge of SQL queries




This is a full-time position, hybrid working model, with the option of working from the Brampton or North York Office.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com



Job Description




 What You’ll Be Doing 


The 
 Senior Data Architect 
 is responsible for promoting Business and IT alignment objectives by setting direction for the creation, definition and maintenance of cross-functional views of the enterprise data architecture in order to create the IT strategic plan and to influence investment decisions. In this role, you will be working with LOBs to understand the business imperatives, business functions, applications and data technology landscape. This role will also be responsible to manage all architecture aspects of a data domain, including providing technical vision and strategy to realize the business outcome. At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role y ou’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.



How You’ll Succeed




 Relationship building - Bridge the gap between stakeholders in CIBC, from C-level to application developers level. Communicate technical concepts in clear and established terms using appropriate channels, off-line and on-line collaboration methodologies. 

 Technical Vision - Identify and evaluate alternative solution options and trade-offs to handle both functional and non-functional requirements. Recommend designs that consider current data assets, applications and architecture, operating models as well target end state data architecture. 

 Lead governance forums - as required to create harmony, ensure that related architectural artifacts , including defined data domain pattern and design patterns, aligned to the architecture standards , are reviewed frequently and is in line with every evolving business and technology landscape. 

 Ensure that the collaborative nature of capabilities such as design and engineering is coupled with tight governance around non-negotiables like security, privacy, availability, and performance. 

 Decision Making and Critical Thinking - Knowledge of traditional and modern data architecture approaches , tools , techniques and best practices for effective use of a broad range of factors, assumptions, frameworks and perspectives when solving problems. 

 Written Communications - Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation. 

 Oral Communications - Ability to express oneself and communicate with others verbally; recognizing that verbal communication is more than just language - it includes tone, style and structure. 




Who You Are




 You can demonstrate experience in : 5 years + End-to-end data architecture with strong knowledge of traditional and modern data architecture platforms, D atabases (SQL & NoSQL), Data warehouse , Data Lake, data services and APIs, messaging and streaming technologies , EDA, DevOps, and Agile methodologies/tools.  Ideally, you are well versed at identifying the need for and ensuring the development of key architecture processes to meet the needs of the business. You keep abreast of the external environment - IT best practices and regulatory guidelines – in order to provide stewardship, advise company executives on appropriate actions/plans and recommend the introduction of new systems to support the changing business environment.  You are good at thinking on an abstract level and eager to learn . We’re looking for someone able to self-drive to discover in order to define and develop solutions to problem-solving. It’s preferred if you have:  Previous experience in Azure Modern Data architecture, including Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, ADLS, Cosmos DB, etc. 

 You embrace and champion change . You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work to deliver your best. 

 You are a bold and accountable leader . You're passionate about developing and coaching to bring out the best in people. You have led diverse, high performing teams. 

 You put our clients first . You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do. 

 You're driven by collective success . You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life. 

 You act like an owner . You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results. 

 Values matter to you . You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. 




What CIBC Offers



At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:


 Thrive : Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home 

 Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity 

 Develop : Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training 

 Prosper : Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan 




What You Need To Know

Data Architect


 


Position Summary:


The Data Architect role requires an individual with a minimum of 8-10 years of experience who possesses a wide range of data architecture and integration experience. The Data Architect is a key technical leadership position that will help set the technical direction, enhancing BI solutions, providing architectural leadership in data warehouse, ETL and analytic deliverables. The candidate must be a problem solver who has acute attention to detail, but able to maintain and drive towards the big picture solution. The candidate must have exceptional communication skills, and be good at mitigating risk and addressing concerns pro-actively. The architect will liaise with internal staff to interpret business demands to design and deliver a flexible data foundation that will support a dynamic analytics environment. The candidate must have a technical background in solution architecture, reporting and analytics, ETL tools and methodology, and various modeling techniques (Application, Data Warehouse, Data Marts, etc.).

 


Position Scope: No revenue or budget accountability



People Management: No Management or Supervision responsibilities



Reporting to: Director, Data Analytics and Reporting



 



Responsibilities: 


· Lead data architecture discussion and design, overseeing design of the information architecture for the applications, data lakes, data warehouses, data marts and staging areas

· Provide technical leadership in all phases of a project from discovery and planning, through implementation and delivery

· Collaborates with project managers and business leaders for all projects involving enterprise data

· Take leadership in addressing data-related problems relating to system integration, compatibility and multiple-platform integration

· Identify and develop opportunities for data reuse, migration or retirement

· Work through all stages of a data solution life cycle: analyze/profile data, create conceptual, logical and physical data model designs, provide guidance on ETL and analytics solutions

· Oversee standardization of data definition, development of data models, and data quality practices

· Participate in data strategy and road map exercises

· Participate in troubleshooting and performance optimization with the BI and Data Engineering teams

 

Qualifications:

 

· A Bachelor's Degree in a technology area, preferable in Computer Science or Engineering

· 8-10+ years equivalent work experience in Information Technology

· 5+ years of hands-on experience in Requirements and Data Analysis, Data Architecture and/or Data Warehousing in an enterprise data environment

· Experience and proven success in leadership roles supporting business analytics, data governance, data management and data quality

· Hands on experience with enterprise data architectures and toolsets, including relational, 3NF and dimensional models

· Experience with data integration tools (e.g. IBM DataStage, Microsoft SSIS), RDMS (e.g. SQL Server, MySQL) and BI Tools ( e.g. Cognos, SSRS, Tableau)

· Experience in Big Data modeling and methodologies (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and setting up data exploration and algorithm execution environments for data science teams 

· Excellent data analysis and problem-solving skills, with a superior attention to detail

· Highly organized, self-motivated, customer oriented and able to work independently as well as within a team

· Ability to communicate across all levels of the organization, with both technical and business stakeholders

· Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions

· Highly flexible and able to quickly adapt to changing priorities

DESCRIPTION


Are you a data analytics specialist? Do you have data warehousing and Hadoop/data lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement AI, IOT, and data analytics projects that help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as machine learning, IoT, batch/real-time data processing, and business intelligence.

As a member of the AWS Professional Services team, you are joining a team that invests in your success by providing comprehensive learning and mentorship programs. Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. We offer a flexible work environment to help you balance your work and personal life while still remaining customer obsessed.



Responsibilities Include




 Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Athena, Glue, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB NoSQL, Relational Database Service (RDS), Amazon EMR and Amazon Redshift.

 Solutions - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, creating packaged Data & Analytics service offerings.

Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services.

 Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or a related field or equivalent professional or military experience

 5+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical and analytical role

 3+ years of experience of data lake/Hadoop platform implementation

 Experience developing software code in one or more programming languages (Java, Python, etc.)

 Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management, and risk mitigation

At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experiences, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. Based in downtown Toronto, we are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and collaborative team working towards transforming the way Canadians shop by creating leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, loyalty, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started! To achieve these goals, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to collaborate and solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be working within the Retail Media Platform team to build a best-in-class Ad tech solution that will allow internal and external users to create, manage and report on advertising campaigns. You will be analyzing data to uncover patterns or issues, building data pipelines and queries that will aggregate the reporting metrics needed in the Retail Media Platform.



What You'll Do




Work with stakeholders to develop solutions that support various data consumers

Help automating reporting pipelines, and build real-time streaming dashboard

Build and implement robust data models and semantic layers

Develop pipelines using Java, Python, DBT, Airflow, and other GCP technologies

Build testing and data validations strategies to ensure reporting integrity

Optimize data queries in different parts of the pipeline

Support reporting and analytics needs from all areas of the business. For example: Developers, Product Managers, Product Designers, Merchandizers, Marketers, and Operations Analysts

Help us in our mission to be a hypotheses-driven product development organization which means data is at the center of everything we do



Does This Sound Like You



BA/BS in math, computer science, engineering or related field

3+ yrs of experience as a data engineer

Hands-on experience with non relational databases

Ability to write complex SQL queries and perform analysis

Experience in data processing using Python or Java

Working experience with Git

Exposure to cloud technology (GCP, AWS, Azure)

Understanding of data warehouse concept

Strong oral and written communication skills

Solid stakeholder management skills

Proven team player that will work well in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

Experience working in an agile environment

Experience in advertising is a plus

Strong desire to learn and to push the boundaries of what can be done to better empower our business with data




How You’ll Succeed



At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!


Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. Data Engineer/ETL 


Leads BCAA’s Data and Analytics Operations (DnA Ops) Data Engineering Practice

Designs scalable solutions that are flexible and can evolve within an ever-changing environment

Deploys data models and analysis for business processes, data usages (flow), process design and data design.

Works closely with DnA CoE data scientists, BI developers, information governance and business stakeholders to lead data processing solutions that deliver value throughout the enterprise

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.


The Opportunity


As senior data pipeline engineer, you will work on distributed systems spanning multiple data centers, thousands of servers and hundreds of billions of messages a day. Ensuring data quality, data integrity and data accuracy is a core part of our identity. Design for new scalable system which data is increasing day by day, including auditing and monitoring systems. You will have a chance to manage projects with small team of 1-2 members which improving your ownership and leadership. You will be eager to solve problems that come from managing and making sense of large amounts of data. Some of the things you’ll get to work on include schema registry, real-time data-ingestion, cross data center replication, enrichment, storage and analytics of the data flow.

We are a small passionate team and we are looking for exceptional individuals to be a part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) our Data Pipeline.

Ready to join an outstanding culture that cares about diversity and inclusion, corporate social responsibility and gives the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, and chart an exciting career?

CGI is more than just an IT company. Be part of a team that supports the local community with the ability draw on global best-in-class talent! Benefits include a share purchase program, profit sharing, wellness credits, training and development programs, and flexible work schedules and locations.

CGI is looking for a Data Engineer for its growing team in Western Canada to help our customers in the energy sector on their digital transformation journey!

The successful candidate will demonstrate a breadth of understanding established and emerging data engineering technologies and experience in the energy sector. Experience with complex data integration, DevOps, DataOps, big data processing, predictive analytics, and data visualization in the energy industry are expected.

Your future duties and responsibilities

We help our energy clients with numerous types of projects covering a variety of different business scenarios including supporting data for business intelligence, data governance and management, customer relationship management, asset management, and enterprise resource planning. The data engineer will have the skills to communicate and deliver modern data engineering products to solve different business problem while building close relationships with both client and CGI team members:

Develop new systems to provide real-time streaming analytics and event processing pipeline based on high velocity data architecture to handle throughput over millions of events per second

Develop enterprise grade data lake to support both business analytical needs and next generation data infrastructure

Develop data integration toolkit to build and manage automated and efficient data pipelines that will consume data from backend services into data repositories and various formats to be consumable by reporting systems and analysts

Help create and implement DataOps, DevOps, and CICD best practices

Support data science teams in developing and deploying new algorithms

Create infrastructure to monitor and manage data integrity and data systems health

Leverage and contribute to industry best practices including proper use of source control, code reviews, data validation and testing

Create and implement engineering best practices and collaborate in the design of effective streamlined processes with partner teams


Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role


5+ years of experience in data management, data engineering and/or software engineering working with SQL, Python, Scala, Java, Databricks, Snowflake/Snowpipes, Azure Data Factory, Informatica, AWS Pipelines, and Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, or GCP)

Experience in designing, implementing, automating and maintenance of large-scale data pipeline processes, providing proficiency with concepts like idempotency, retry and backoff strategies, data parsing techniques, invalid data handling, data staging, code reuse

Experience in developing containerized data applications and hosting data systems in container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.

Experience deploying data infrastructure

Experience in a DataOps, DevOps, CI/CD environment with technologies and platforms such as Git, Jenkins, Docker/Kubernetes, and others is an asset

Experience in rapidly prototyping a data product from scratch and leading the implementation in production.

Experience with recognized industry patterns, methodologies, and techniques assets

Experience working with RDBMS technologies including MySQL

Experience with data warehousing technologies (SQL Server, Snowflake and/or Redshift)

Experience with infrastructure including Azure & AWS (S3, Gen2 Data Lake, CloudWatch, Monitor, RedShift, Synapse, CloudFormation, Resource Manager), Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, Bazel

Experience with a broad range of data sources such as RESTful APIs, SOAP, XML, JSON, client stream, transactional, video, SCADA

Experience with ML stack, including PyTorch, Plotly / Dash, Parquet, DVC, and Dask


Build your career with us.


It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.
